item.title: Jessica add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "Between two evils, I always pick the one I never tried before." -- Mae West

item.title: Jessica add a quote by W. Somerset Maugham
item.description: "She had a pretty gift for quotation, which is a serviceable substitute for wit." -- W. Somerset Maugham

item.title: Jessica add a quote by W. H. Auden
item.description: "Among those whom I like or admire, I can find no common denominator, but among those whom I love, I can; all of them make me laugh." -- W. H. Auden

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Bob Dylan
item.description: "You need something to open up a new door, to show you something you seen before but overlooked a hundred times or more" -- Bob Dylan

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Jack Kerouac
item.description: "The human bones are but vain lines dawdling, the whole universe a blank mold of stars." -- Jack Kerouac

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Ben Folds
item.description: "You have made me smile again; in fact I may be sore from it- it's been awhile." -- Ben Folds

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Pablo Neruda
item.description: "Todo te lo tragaste, como la lejania, como el mar, como el tiempo... Ese fue mi destino y en el viajo mi anhelo, y en el mi anhelo, todo en ti fue naufragio! (You swallowed everything, like distance, like the sea, like time. This was my destiny and it was the voyage of my longing, in it my longing fell, in you everything sank.)" -- Pablo Neruda

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Epictetus
item.description: "Only the educated are free." -- Epictetus

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Maya Angelou
item.description: "Had I known that the heart breaks slowly, dismantling itself into unrecognizable plots of misery... had I known yet I would have loved you, your brash and insolent beauty, your heavy comedic face and knowledge of sweet delights, but from a distance I would have left you whole and wholly for the delectation of those who wanted more and cared less." -- Maya Angelou

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Alfred Lord Tennyson
item.description: "So sad, so fresh the days that are no more." -- Alfred Lord Tennyson

item.title: Jessica add a quote by James Wright
item.description: "Across the road, tadpoles are dancing on the quarter thumbnail of the moon. They cant see, not yet." -- James Wright

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Samuel Beckett
item.description: "The end is in the beginning and yet you go on." -- Samuel Beckett

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Ani DiFranco
item.description: "The bathroom mirror has not budged, the woman who lives there can tell the truth from the stuff they say and looks me in the eye- says do you prefer the easy way? No? Well ok then, dont cry." -- Ani DiFranco

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Ntozake Shange
item.description: "i found god in myself and i loved her i loved her fiercely" -- Ntozake Shange

item.title: Jessica add a quote by W. Somerset Maugham
item.description: "Cronshaw stopped for a moment to drink. He had pondered for twenty years the problem whether he loved liquor because it made him talk or whether he loved conversation because it made him thirsty." -- W. Somerset Maugham

item.title: Jessica add a quote by William Hazlitt
item.description: "Man is the only animal that laughs and weeps; for he is the only animal that is struck with the difference between what things are, and what they ought to be." -- William Hazlitt

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Cicero
item.description: "If you have a garden and a library, you have everything you need." -- Cicero

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Tom Robbins
item.description:
"The beet is the most intense of vegetables. The radish, admittedly, is more feverish, but the fire of the radish is a cold fire, the fire of discontent not of passion. Tomatoes are lusty enough, yet there runs through tomatoes an undercurrent of frivolity. Beets are deadly serious.
Slavic peoples get their physical characteristics from potatoes, their smoldering inquietude from radishes, their seriousness from beets.
The beet is the melancholy vegetable, the one most willing to suffer. You can't squeeze blood out of a turnip...
The beet is the murderer returned to the scene of the crime. The beet is what happens when the cherry finishes with the carrot. The beet is the ancient ancestor of the autumn moon, bearded, buried, all but fossilized; the dark green sails of the grounded moon-boat stitched with veins of primordial plasma; the kite string that once connected the moon to the Earth now a muddy whisker drilling desperately for rubies.
The beet was Rasputin's favorite vegetable. You could see it in his eyes." -- Tom Robbins

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Graham Roumieu
item.description: "Ok. Listen. I not know where all you morons come from but holy water no hurt Bigfoot. Garlic and Crucifix also no. Fire, Pitchfork, Silver Bullet OK. Cryptonite do nothing. It not even real. Please stop sending letters asking "What you vulnerability? What Bigfoot?" Like I tell. What next me bank account number? Why not you invest time in moving out of parent basement? Maybe have sex or something. Yes I be talking to you Steve. Youuu! Stalking is a crime Steve." -- Graham Roumieu

item.title: Jessica add a quote by William James
item.description: "A great many people think they are thinking when they are merely rearranging their prejudices." -- William James

item.title: Jessica add a quote by William F. Buckley Jr.
item.description: "I won't insult your intelligence by suggesting that you really believe what you just said." -- William F. Buckley Jr.

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Miss Piggy
item.description: "Beauty is in the eye of the beholder and it may be necessary from time to time to give a stupid or misinformed beholder a black eye." -- Miss Piggy

item.title: Jessica add a quote by P.G. Wodehouse
item.description: "At the age of eleven or thereabouts women acquire a poise and an ability to handle difficult situations which a man, if he is lucky, manages to achieve somewhere in the later seventies." -- P.G. Wodehouse

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "The road to hell is paved with adverbs." -- Stephen King

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Jorge Luis Borges
item.description: "I have always imagined that Paradise will be a kind of library." -- Jorge Luis Borges

item.title: Jessica add a quote by G.K. Chesterton
item.description: "If there were no God, there would be no atheists." -- G.K. Chesterton

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Neil Simon
item.description: "I LOVE living, I have some problems with my LIFE, but living is the best thing they've come up with so far." -- Neil Simon

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Anaïs Nin
item.description: "We don't see things as they are, we see them as we are." -- Anaïs Nin

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Michael Ryan
item.description:
"Consider A Move
The steady time of being unknown, in solitude, without friends, is not a steadiness that sustains. I hear your voice waver on the phone:
<i>Haven't talked to anyone for days. I drive around. I sit in parking lots.</i> The voice zeroes through my ear, and waits. What should I say? There are ways
to meet people you will want to love? I know of none. You come out stronger having gone through this? I no longer believe that, if I once did. Consider a move,
a change, a job, a new place to live, someplace you'd like to be. <i>That's not it</i>, you say. Now time turns back. We almost touch. Then what is? I ask. What is?" -- Michael Ryan
